name: Pertains to goal
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG
description: Indicates that the resource is related to either the measurement, achievement or progress towards the referenced goal.

element.definition: Indicates that the resource is related to either the measurement, achievement or progress towards the referenced goal.
element.comments: This extension is  limited to subject-specific activity-related resources (events & intents).  I.e. This can't be put on Goal or Patient.  This association isn't for the purpose of goal management, but for things such as noting that a particular observation result, prescription or other activity is pertinent to the achievement (or possibly non-achievement) of the referenced goal.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
Indicates that the resource is related to either the measurement, achievement or progress towards the referenced goal.
element.comments: This extension is  limited to subject-specific activity-related resources (events & intents).  I.e. This can't be put on Goal or Patient.  This association isn't for the purpose of goal management, but for things such as noting that a particular observation result, prescription or other activity is pertinent to the achievement (or possibly non-achievement) of the referenced goal.
